metadata.synopsis: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - ReCon: loadlevel WLD_Main_A - ReCon: goto 149.76, 26.24, 434.31- Approach the three NPCs; the dialogue should trigger automatically

37.speaker: Brynna
37.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

97.speaker: Andrick
97.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Freeze and hold up your hands.

87.speaker: Andrick
87.text: They might be a healer, Bry.

115.speaker: Brynna
115.context: NodeContext: She is resolved not to let player come any closer. (the 'he' refers to player here).

110.speaker: Andrick
110.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

90.speaker: Brynna
90.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Useless. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

72.speaker: Edowin
72.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

17.speaker: Andrick
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

58.speaker: Brynna
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

51.speaker: Brynna
51.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
51.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

106.speaker: Brynna
106.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
106.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: You're mistaken - I'm no True Soul.

75.speaker: Brynna
75.text: A True Soul - like you - has been chosen by the Absolute. You speak with Her voice.

104.speaker: Brynna
104.text: Your words are Her command. She grants you the power to enforce Her will.

88.speaker: Andrick
88.text: What...? Are you... are you testing us?

45.speaker: Andrick
45.text: The Absolute is our goddess. She's going to rip down the old world order, start a new one.

81.speaker: Andrick
81.text: Then we'll be the ones with the power - well, you will firstly, True Soul. You don't need me to explain that.

91.speaker: Brynna
91.text: And when the time comes, the True Souls - you - will rule.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: Bah. I will serve at no ruler's side but my queen's.

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: Please. Any supposed new god would have an uphill battle.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: I don't serve, and I don't rule. With or without tadpole.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: That fellow was infected, like us. Is this the mark of a True Soul?

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: That fellow had a tadpole in his head, and they consider him blessed? Chosen? What madness is this?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: A crude summary. You have more to learn of our faith, novice.

9.speaker: Brynna
9.text: I'm sorry, True Soul. I... only repeated what I thought I knew.

65.speaker: Brynna
65.text: It seems the Absolute still has a great deal to teach me.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: Oh, I like these two. All zeal and no brains.
105.context: NodeContext: Nearly hungry tone. He's ready to take advantage of their belief in him.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Perhaps you can help me. I'm looking for the druid Halsin.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Why are you out here? The wilderness is dangerous.

35.speaker: Brynna
35.text: We know that all too well. But... the Absolute sent us here.

102.speaker: Andrick
102.text: We're looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.

59.speaker: Andrick
59.text: We don't know what they look like, but anyone who survived that crash is bound to be injured. That's enough to get us started.

52.speaker: Andrick
52.text: The Absolute wants them found. At any cost.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on Andrick glancing at Edowin's corpse on 'at any cost'.NodeContext: Falters slight on 'at any cost', glancing down at his fallen comrade, Edowin.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'm a survivor of that crash. Looks like you found me.

50.speaker: Andrick
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: About to turn hostileNodeContext: Incredulous, then quickly resolving to attack. The player revealed themselves as his target, Brin-ah.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: What happened to your brother exactly?

43.speaker: Andrick
43.text: An owlbear. It had him on the ground before we had a chance to react.
43.context: NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

27.speaker: Andrick
27.text: We were looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.

1.speaker: Andrick
1.text: ...But instead of them, Edowin found an owlbear. An angry one.
1.context: NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

113.speaker: Andrick
113.text: We managed to drag him away, but the beast's claws had already done their work.
113.context: NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

25.speaker: Andrick
25.text: I told Edowin not to look in that cave - it was filthy with owlbear tracks.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You need to find the beast and avenge your brother.

36.speaker: Brynna
36.text: It killed one of us. It killed Edowin. It's an enemy of the Absolute.

67.speaker: Brynna
67.text: You're right. The beast must be destroyed.

80.speaker: Andrick
80.text: The cave is just ahead. It was too much for us before, but... but if you could help us, True Soul... we may stand a chance.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: The beast is dead. You should be on your way.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I killed an owlbear nearby. If that's what attacked your brother, consider him avenged.

78.speaker: Brynna
78.text: May the Absolute continue to guide your hand. As for us, we won't take any more of your time.
78.context: NodeContext: Amazed, with a dash of religious fervour.

13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick and Brynna leave, setting off to continue their patrol mission (they vanish off-stage permanently once out of view) or to go to the mouth of the owlbear cave, where the players can meet them again, In either case, they'll move in the same direction.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Forget the owlbear. You're still alive - so go.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Forget the owlbear. You're still alive - so go.

4.speaker: Andrick
4.text: I suppose... I suppose he'd want us to go on - find a way to honour his sacrifice.
4.context: NodeContext: Reasoning with himself. 'It's what Edowin would have wanted.'

41.speaker: Brynna
41.context: NodeContext: Undaunted. Eager to resume her holy mission.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: You should get out of here.

71.speaker: Andrick
71.text: Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?
71.context: NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

10.speaker: Andrick
10.text: A True Soul. Thank the Absolute. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.

83.speaker: Edowin
83.text: Mind the True Soul. They will - they - they...
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: He's wounded. I'd like to help - if you'll let me.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: His wounds look deep. I might be able to help.

2.speaker: Andrick
2.text: He's hurt badly. An owlbear got him deep. If there's anything you can do...

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I will go where I wish.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Don't you recognise a True Soul when you see one?

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I will go where I wish.

89.speaker: Brynna
89.text: I'm so, so sorry. It's our brother - True Soul Edowin. He's injured, and I... I wasn't thinking.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. The parasite writhes in your head.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

29.speaker: Brynna
29.text: What are you doing?! Your sword, brother. Now.
29.context: NodeContext: Player is attempting to psionically infiltrate her mind

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
